thread.title: Pinterest lands permanent office in Downtown Seattle
thread.title_full: Pinterest lands permanent office in Downtown Seattle

author: TRD Staff
title: Pinterest lands permanent office in Downtown Seattle
text: Pinterest will move out of its WeWork desk into a permanent office in Downtown Seattle. The San Francisco-based social media bookmarking site has leased 21,500 square feet in Met Park East at 1730 Minor Avenue, [GeekWire](https://www.geekwire.com/2024/pinterest-inks-lease-for-new-engineering-office-in-seattle/#:~:text=The%20city%20represents%20one%20of,31%20of%20last%20year.) and the[ Puget Sound Business Journal ](https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/news/2024/10/14/pinterest-leases-space-met-park-east.html)reported. Terms of the deal with landlord Beacon Capital Partners, based in Boston, were not disclosed. More than half of the 389,000-square-foot tower is available for lease, according to Beacon’s website. Tenants include Beacon and Providence, according to public filings reviewed by the Business Journal. Pinterest[ entered the Seattle market in 2016](https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/blog/techflash/2016/08/pinterest-choses-seattle-for-itsfirst-engineering.html) with the opening of[ a sales and engineering office](https://www.wework.com/ideas/workspace-solutions/case-studies/pinterest-case-study) in the WeWork office. Within a year, the company reported it had 55 Seattle-based employees. The publicly traded company’s new digs at Met Park East include a gourmet catering kitchen, fitness center and outdoor green space, according to CBRE. Neither Pinterest, nor CBRE, which handles leases for Met Park East, returned a request for comment from the newspaper. The office vacancy in Seattle rose 2.1 percent year over year to 28.2 percent in the third, according to Savills. But the local office market is girding for a turnaround, with commercial brokers[ expressing “cautious optimism”](https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/news/2024/10/11/office-market-optimism-vacancy-rates.html) that the worst may be over as employers such as Seattle-based [ Amazon.com](https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/organization/amazon) call employees back to the office full time. — Dana Bartholomew Read more Commercial San Francisco Adyen subleases Pinterest offices in biggest SF deal of the year Commercial San Francisco Pinterest to bail out of SF offices in SoMa Commercial Seattle Avalara moves HQ from Seattle, downsizes offices at former hub
